financialdatapy.stock moduleÂ¶

This module retrieves financial data of a stock.

exception financialdatapy.stock.CountryCodeValidationFailed[source]Â¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when country code is not in alpha-3 code format.

class financialdatapy.stock.Stock(symbol: str, country_code: str = 'USA')[source]Â¶

Bases: object

A class representing a stock or a company.

Parameters

  • symbol (str) â Symbol of a company/stock.

  • country_code (str, optional) â Country where the stock is listed. The format should follow alpha-3 code (ISO 3166), defaults to âUSAâ.

financials(financial: str = 'income_statement', period: str = 'annual') â pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]Â¶

Get financial statements as reported.

Parameters

  • financial (str, optional) â Which financial statement to retrieve. Input string should be either âincome_statementâ, âbalance_sheetâ, or âcash_flowâ, defaults to âincome_statementâ

  • period (str, optional) â Either âannualâ or âquarter, defaults to âannualâ.

Returns

Financial statement as reported.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

Example

>>> from financialdatapy.stock import Stock
>>> comp = Stock('AAPL')
>>> ic_as_reported = comp.financials('income_statement', 'annual')
>>> ic_as_reported
     CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF OPERATIONS| 12 Months Ended
USD ($) shares in Thousands, $ in Millions|   Sep. 26, 2020| Sep. 28, 2019| Sep. 29, 2018
------------------------------------------|----------------|--------------|--------------
                                 Net sales|          274515|        260174|        265595
historical(start: str = '1900-01-01', end: Optional[str] = None) â pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]Â¶

Get historical stock price data.

Parameters

  • start (str, optional) â Start date to query. Format should be in ISO 8601, defaults to 1900-01-01.

  • end (str, optional) â End date to query. Format should be in ISO 8601, defaults to the date of today.

Returns

Historical stock price data.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

Example

>>> from financialdatapy.stock import Stock
>>> comp = Stock('AAPL')
>>> price = comp.historical('2021-1-1', '2021-1-5')
>>> price
          |  close|   open|   high|    low|    volume
----------|-------|-------|-------|-------|----------
2021-01-04| 129.41| 133.52| 133.61| 126.76| 143301900
standard_financials(financial: str = 'income_statement', period: str = 'annual') â pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]Â¶

Get standard financial statements.

Parameters

  • financial (str, optional) â One of the three financial statement. âincome_statementâ or âbalance_sheetâ or âcash_flowâ, defaults to âincome_statementâ.

  • period (str, optional) â Either âannualâ or âquarterâ, defaults to âannualâ.

Returns

Standard financial statement.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

Example

>>> from financialdatapy.stock import Stock
>>> comp = Stock('AAPL')
>>> std_ic = comp.standard_financials('income_statement', 'annual')
>>> std_ic
             |          TTM|    9/26/2020| ...
-------------|-------------|-------------|----
Total Revenue| 3.471550e+11| 2.745150e+11| ...
